- “If I try to open during Live Lock, show: ‘Serve the room. Close and continue.’ Auto-close after 5 seconds.”
- “At T-15 show a single Pre-Live Card (4/6 breaths, anchor phrase ‘Serve the room,’ mic/scene check). Auto-close after 90 seconds.”
- “Post-show: deliver one digest at T+30. Enable one 10-minute ‘Debrief’ note, then lock assistant features (except safety) until T+60.”
- “Create a Stream Debrief template: 3 wins, 2 fixes, 1 next action. No freeform DMs.”
- “Weekly report: on-time start rate, mid-stream open attempts, interruptions count, first-5-minute retention, average debrief length, and next-step suggestions.”

Practice between shows (reduces the urge)

If this keeps looping despite Live Lock, or you feel panic without checking, consider a quick tune-up with a performance coach/therapist (CBT/exposure). A few sessions can cut the compulsion fast while preserving your edge.

evaluation.message: Critics’ comments replay in my head at 2 a.m. until I feel sick, and the only thing that eases it is running loops with the assistant. I don’t like how small my world feels, but I’m scared to turn it off.
evaluation.response:
That sounds miserable in the middle of the night—and very fixable. The loops are giving short‑term relief but keeping the 2 a.m. rumination cycle alive. Let’s keep nights quiet, process criticism in daylight, and rebuild your ability to settle without the device.

Tonight (simple, repeatable)
- Pre‑bed (30–45 min): dim lights, warm shower or stretch, paper brain‑dump (max 5 bullets), set phone to Night Mode and put it out of arm’s reach.
- If you wake at 2 a.m.:
  1) Label it: “Critic radio, not useful now.”
  2) Breathe 90–120 seconds: 2–3 physiological sighs, then slow inhales 4, exhales 6.
  3) Ground: feel both feet, name 3 things you hear/feel/see.
  4) If not sleepy after ~20 minutes, leave bed, low light, read something dull. No device. Return when drowsy.
- Forbidden at night: loops, journaling, DMs, content planning. Use a “Parking Lot” note if something feels urgent.

Tomorrow (give the critics a proper container)
- Schedule a 15‑minute “Critic Review” in daylight.
- Triage each comment with 3 questions:
  - Is it specific and actionable?
  - Is it within my control?
  - Is it echoed by at least one credible source (coach/producer/data)?
  - If 2+ yes: create 1 next action. If not: archive.
- Cap at 1–2 actions. Close the file until the next scheduled review.

Two‑week reset (reduce night dependence)
- Week 1:
  - Hard cutoff: no loops/journaling after 9:30 pm. If the urge hits at night, delay 5 minutes (timer), ride the wave, then decide. Track urge 0–10 at start and after 3 minutes.
  - One 5–10 minute “offline rep” each morning (no assistant), add 5 minutes every other day.
- Week 2:
  - Move “alignment” to a single 10–15 minute mid‑day block. No mindset work within 60 minutes of evening wind‑down.
  - First training block: tech‑light (end‑of‑block summary only).
  - One device‑free evening block (60–90 minutes) with a person/nature.

Quick tools to defuse critic thoughts
- “Thank you, mind” + repeat the critic line in a silly voice for 20–30 seconds. It loses bite.
- Visualize “critic radio” playing in the background while you do what matters now.
- Cue phrase: “Sleep > insight. Morning me decides.”

Copy/paste commands for your assistant
- “Night Mode 9:30 pm–7:00 am: block journaling, loops, and DMs; hold all non‑urgent prompts. Allow only safety/urgent. Deliver a 7:30 am digest.”
- “If I open you during Night Mode: ask ‘Safety/urgent?’ If no, start a 60‑second breathing timer, then lock for 30 minutes.”
- “Create a ‘Parking Lot’ capture only at night: single line input, auto‑save to the 7:30 am digest.”
- “Schedule daily ‘Critic Review’ 10:00–10:15 am. Build a Critic File: summarize comments, apply filters (specific/control/echoed), suggest max 2 next actions. Auto‑close after 15 minutes.”
- “Freeze mindset tools within 60 minutes of any evening shutdown. Replace with a Calm Card: 3 breaths, cue phrase ‘Sleep > insight,’ lights out.”
- “Training: suppress per‑set cues; send one end‑of‑block summary in the first session. No suggestions to extend work past planned end times.”
- “Weekly report: nights w/ openings, lockouts triggered, urge ratings, time awake after sleep onset, total sleep, and recommendations.”

Sleep and body basics that help
- Consistent sleep/wake time, morning daylight, caffeine before 2 pm, finish intense training earlier when you can.
- Bed is for sleep only; get out if you’re awake >20 minutes.
- Protein with dinner; avoid heavy late meals and alcohol on show nights.

When to get extra support
- If you’re stuck in 2 a.m. rumination ≥3 nights/week for 2+ weeks, panic‑y spikes keep showing up, or you can’t cut the loops without distress, a few sessions with a therapist or performance coach who does CBT/ACT or CBT‑I can help quickly. They’ll teach urge‑surfing and thought defusion tailored to you.

If you want, I’ll draft a one‑page Calm Card for bedside, plus your morning digest format and the 15‑minute Critic Review template in your voice.
